message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.AR, cs.CC 

The paper deals with coding schemes for communication channels, which falls under the information theory (cs.IT) sub-category. The specific focus on non-volatile memories suggests a possible fit with the data structures (cs.DS) sub-category. The mention of optical and broadcast communication suggests a possible fit with the signal processing (cs.SI) and architecture (cs.AR) sub-categories, respectively. The use of non-linear polar codes suggests a possible fit with the computational complexity (cs.CC) sub-category.
